Requirement: The system should provide real-time monitoring of machine health to detect issues promptly
The software should support integration with various sensors capable of capturing relevant machine data
It should be capable of collecting and aggregating data from multiple sensors across different machines
The system should offer intuitive and visually appealing dashboards to present machine health data
The software should send proactive alerts and notifications in case of anomalies or potential failures
It should leverage machine learning algorithms to provide predictive analytics for early detection of machine failures
The system should allow remote access to machine health data, enabling monitoring from anywhere
It should store historical machine health data for trend analysis and long-term performance assessment
The software should be capable of integrating with existing factory management systems for seamless data exchange
The system should be scalable to accommodate a growing number of machines and sensors in the factory
Robust security measures should be implemented to protect the data and prevent unauthorized access
The software should leverage cloud computing for data storage, processing, and scalability
The system should have an intuitive and user-friendly interface, making it easy for operators to navigate and interact with the software
It should allow users to customize and configure dashboards according to their specific monitoring needs
The software should provide advanced data analytics capabilities to identify patterns, correlations, and anomalies in machine health data
The system should integrate with maintenance management systems to schedule and track maintenance activities based on machine health insights
The software should be compatible with mobile devices, enabling users to access machine health data on the go
It should offer diagnostic tools to aid in identifying the root causes of machine failures or abnormalities
The system should maintain comprehensive logs and audit trails of machine health data and user activities
The software should provide APIs and support for easy integration with third-party applications and services
The system should have a minimum uptime of 99% to ensure continuous monitoring of machine health
The software should have a mean time between failures (MTBF) of at least 10,000 hours to minimize system downtime
The system should support a minimum of 10,000 connected machines simultaneously without significant degradation in performance
The software should provide real-time data updates with a maximum response time of 500 milliseconds
The system should be able to handle a minimum of 1,000 sensor data updates per second for efficient data processing
The software should support a minimum of 1 terabyte (TB) of data storage for long-term machine health data retention
The system should retain machine health data for a minimum of 5 years to facilitate historical analysis
The software should achieve a minimum compression ratio of 10:1 to optimize storage space and reduce bandwidth requirements
The system should use Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) with a minimum key length of 256 bits to secure data transmission and storage
The software should operate efficiently within a maximum bandwidth consumption of 1 megabit per second (Mbps) per connected machine
The system should support a minimum of 95% of commonly used industrial sensors and IoT devices available in the market
The software should have a maximum MTTR of 2 hours to minimize downtime in case of system failures
The system should achieve a minimum accuracy rate of 95% in detecting machine health issues and anomalies
The software should provide measurements with a minimum precision of 0.1% to ensure accurate machine health monitoring
The system should be capable of handling a minimum of 500 concurrent user requests without significant performance degradation
The software should be compatible with at least 90% of commonly used operating systems, including Windows, Linux, and macOS
The system should support software updates with a maximum frequency of once per month to ensure stability and compatibility
The software should have a maximum MTTD of 30 minutes to rapidly identify machine health issues
The system should be interoperable with standard industrial protocols such as OPC UA, MQTT, and Modbus for seamless integration with other factory systems
The software should have a minimum of 2 redundant servers to ensure high availability and fault tolerance
